title: Will Riot ever read the boards?

You forget one thing:

The (additional) income that Riot Games would generate if the customer service (and this includes also the interactions with the community in their own boards) would be better.

Unfortunately this is not measurable.
But it has a positive income effect it a company offer a good customer service and the customer are satisfied. And this is even more important as a f2p game publisher.

For example:
I am very dissatisfied about the bad customer service here in the boards (and NA board is really better than the EUW boards). I don't think that Riot really listen to the community and correct - for example - false decisions (Riot dislikes to confirm that they made a wrong decision).

So that's why I decided to not buy Riot Points any more.
That is around 400-500 USD per year less income for Riot Games. OK, that is not a lot of money for Riot. But if only 200 other players (with did the same, that ist 1 FTE (and we don't need 1 FTE to manage the board).

So it makes really sense that a f2p game publisher listen more to the community (if the feedback is factual). The publisher could earn more income resp. he loses less income from pressent customers.

I understand it can be frustrating when the company running the game doesn't appear to be listening or responsive to community feedback, trust me I do. That said though I also understand that for games with large player bases such as LoL it's unfeasible to respond to every single thread, request or complaint that comes up, especially when some of those are unreasonable and/or unrealistic. Yes companies can do a better job responding and interacting with their communities, but it doesn't necessarily mean that they don't listen just because a request or two doesn't get implemented.

But for example in the German board there is no interaction from Riot at all:

https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/de/redtracker

If a company like Riot do not respond any questions in their own board, it is no suprise that the community thinks, Riot do not read the threads.

From what I understand there are different Riot offices in each of the different regions (the one in NA being the main one of course), each with their own staff and region specific policies. The main process in German is:

- If you write a suggestions for improvement to the Riot Support, they answer that you should write into the board.
- In the board, Riot will not answer/interact with the community (as you can see in the redtracker).
- So if you wirte to the Riot Support that Riot do not read in the board and interact with the community, they answer again that you should write in the board (and the Support cannot inform the responsible team that they should read the thread).

It seems that the German board is the trash can for all suggestions for improvement.


>I can't speak for the German staff, but at least here on the NA boards there is occasional interaction between players and staff. Again though for games with large player bases such as LoL it's unfeasible to respond to every single thread, request or complaint that comes up, especially when some of those are unreasonable and/or unrealistic.

Yes, I understand that Riot cannot answer in all threads.
But they have not to answer all the "balancing threads" where the writers normally want to buff their main champ and nerf their counter pick. After that, there are not so much threads left.

And it is not necessary to answer with all details. It is OK to write an answer like "Thank you for your suggestions. Our responsible team will check this." That is only 1 minute to write this post (after several minutes of reading the thread).

After over 1 year, no one from the merch team of Riot even answer in one of the threads about the Ahri statue here in the NA board. Several players are very disappointed that the new version was limited and sold out at once (before I even known that there is a release). After 3 years waiting for this statue (which was first announced non-limited), it is very sad that Riot don't answer.
As a former Product Manager I have to say that was the worst decision in the history of Product Management. And it seems that Riot does not care about it, writes any statements or has a plan to correct this wrong decision.


But yes, in the German board it is even worse; no communication at all.
Yes, Riot is mainly active in the NA board. But it is also important to interact with the community in the other boards.
This month I saw an interesting thread in the German board. All other players wrote that no Rioter reads here and he should write this in the NA board. But he answered that he is not so good in English and asked if someone could translate this and write it in the NA board.
So It is important that Riot also interacts in the non-English boards because severals players - with good ideas - haven't the English skills to write in the NA board.

And there are also topics that concern only the DACH region (DACH = Germany, Austria and (the german-speaking part of) Switzerland). So it makes sense to write these topics in the German board and not in the NA board. But no Rioter will read this topic. Contact the German Riot Support does not help because they answer that they are not responsible for this topic (and cannot trasmit this to the responsible team) and you should write this in the board (where you never get an answer).
So it is impossible to contact Riot for DACH-only topics. I think you agree that this is not a good customer service / interaction with the community.

Depends on which subboards you are talking about. 

Story and Art boards have alot of interaction. Dev corner and tech support have weekly moments the Rioters are active. Memes and games have them lurking all the time, they selectively respond to gameplay boards, and rarely respond here in PB, though they may still be lurkers. 

So, your point of saying that you want Riot to read the boards is more geared towards them not responding to what you want them to respond to. Which we have no idea what you want them to respond to.

If you want them to nerf Irelia or remove Yasuo, you first need to get good and understand how to counter play them. Being highly mechanically mobile doesn't mean you dont have a counter play. 

If you want them to ban someone, then the boards is not the right place to do it. Instead, you need to use the post game screen lobby  or submit a ticket to https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us .
